Package jibe.sdk.client

Parent package for all Jibe SDK classes

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
JibeServiceListener A callback interface, to be implemented by client applications, which allows the Jibe Realtime Service to pass a notification to the client applications once a connection to the requested Jibe Service has been established.
 

Class Summary
JibeIntents Defines the Intents that are generated by the Jibe Realtime Engine.
JibeServiceBase<E> The base class for derived Jibe Services.
JibeServiceListenerAdapter Adapter class for implementing JibeServiceListener interface
JibeServiceResult The Result object that gets returned from all calls to Jibe Realtime Engines.
 

Enum Summary
JibeServiceListener.ConnectFailedReason  
 

Exception Summary
JibeApp2AppNotConfiguredException The exception that is thrown when the application's App2App was not recognised.
JibeServiceException An exception that gets thrown when a Jibe Service API function call fails.
JibeServiceNotConnectedException The exception that is thrown when a client application calls a Jibe Service API function, but without having successfully connected to the Jibe Service Interface.
 

Package jibe.sdk.client Description

Parent package for all Jibe SDK classes

Android requires functionality implemented in other processes to be accessed through a Remote Interface defined in AIDL. In this programming model, the client application is responsible for binding to the remote interface and managing the connection to it.

Jibe manage this process using the classes in this package so that the application developer can focus on development of the application rather than the support functions. Jibe provides both low-level and high-level APIs in order to serve the needs of different developers and customers.
